{HOUSING IN GUERNSEY}
Guernsey has a tiered housing system. The 'local' market is open to those born in the island and those who satisfy residential qualifications. These can be marriage to an island born person or having been resident for a period of fifteen years. Housing licences can be granted to enable non-locals to live in local market property. To qualify, one must be deemed an essential worker and for there to be no local applicant suitable for the job. A licence holder must inhabit a house with a rateable value exceeding Â£45. The 'open' market is available to all purchasers. Homes on this market tend to exceed a price of Â£80,000. If a local person purchases a home in this market, they forfeit their local resident status.
